required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Generic Mycophenolate Mofetil Safety Study for Prophylaxis in de Novo Renal Transplant Patients in Jordan
clinical_study.official_title: MyOra® (Mycophenolate Mofetil) Post-Authorization Safety Study for Prophylaxis in de Novo Renal Transplant Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this observational study was to assess the safety and efficacy of generic mycophenolate mofetil in de novo renal transplant patients in Jordan where no visits or intervention(s) additional to the daily practice were performed.

detailed_description.textblock: A single center, observational, open-label, longitudinal, prospective study combined with retrospective data collection for 12 de novo renal transplant patients. Ten patients were prospectively followed for 12 months after receiving MyOra® (mycophenolate mofetil) and two patients were previously on MyOra® (mycophenolate mofetil), thus their data was retrospectively collected from their hospital records and all relevant workup tests results. Outcomes include occurrence of AEs and proportion of patients with normal graft function.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence, severity and relationship of adverse events (AEs) to the Study medication
primary_outcome.description: Rate of AEs, SAEs and laboratory tests abnormalities will be calculated

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with normal graft function
secondary_outcome.description: Graft status was estimated through the evaluation of kidney function in all patients enrolled in the study

clinical_study.condition: Acute Transplant Rejection in Patients Receiving Allogeneic Renal Transplant

intervention.description: Film Coated Tablet, each tablet contains 500mg Mycophenolate Mofetil

study_pop.textblock: Patients were enrolled from a single public hospital in Jordan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient received de novo renal transplant
- Patient treated with MyOra® according to the attending physician's judgment (either post-transplant or induction)
- Patient provided written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity to mycophenolate mofetil, mycophenolic acid (MPA) or any of the constituents of MyOra®
